gurmukhi: inrK cMfkw qws ko qbY bcn ieh kIn ]
transliteration: Nirakh Channdakaa Taas Ko Tabai Bachanndeh Koon||
translation: Chandika, seeing her, thus spoke to her;

gurmukhi: hy puqRI qUM kwlkw hohu ju muJ mY lIn ]76]
transliteration: He Poutroo Toon Kaalkaadhoh(u) Ju Muih Mai Loon||76||
translation: “O my daughter Kalika, merge in me.”76.

gurmukhi: sunq bcn Xy cMf ko qw mih geI smwie ]
transliteration: Sounat Bachanndye Channd Ko Taa Maih Gado Samaae||
translation: Hearing these words of Chandi, she merged in her;

gurmukhi: ijau gMgw kI Dwr mY jmnw pYTI Dwie ]77]
transliteration: Jio Gadgadkoo Dhaar Mai Jamnaa Paithoo Dhaae||77||
translation: Like Yamuna falling into the current of Ganges.77.

gurmukhi: bYT qbY igrjw Ar dyvn bu`iD iehY mn m`iD ibcwrI ]
transliteration: Baith Tabai Girjaa Ar Devan Buddh(i) Ihai Man Maddh(i) Bichdaroo||
translation: Then the goddess Parvati together with the gods, reflected thus in their minds;

gurmukhi: ju`D kIey ibnu Pyr iPrY nih BUm sBY ApnI AvDwrI ]
transliteration: Juddh Kooe Bin(u) Pher Phirai Nab(i) Bhoom Sabbai Apnoo Avdhdaroo||
translation: That the demons are considering the earth as their own, it is futile to get it back without the war.

gurmukhi: ieMdR kihE Ab FIl bny nih mwq suno Xh bwq hmwrI ]
transliteration: Indra Kahio Ab Dhool Bade Nah(i) Maat Souno Yah Baat Hamaroo||
translation: Indra said, “O mother, listen to my supplication, we should not delay any more.”

gurmukhi: dYqn ky bD kwj clI rx cMf pRcMf BujMgn kwrI ]78]
transliteration: Daitan Ke Badh Kaaj Chaloo Ran Channd Prachanndd Bhujanad Kdaroo||78||
translation: Then the mighty Chhandi like a terrible black she-serpent, moved into the battlefield, in order to kill the demons.78.

gurmukhi: kMcn sy qn KMjn sy diRg kMjn kI suKmw skucI hY ]
transliteration: Kanchanndse Tan Khanndan Se Drig Kanjan Koo Soukhmaa Sakouchoo Hai||
translation: The body of the goddess is like gold, and her eyes are like the eyes of mamola (wagtail), before which the beauty of lotus in feeling shy.

gurmukhi: lY kr qwr suDw kr mY mD mUrq sI AMg AMg rcI hY ]
transliteration: Lai Kar Taar Sudhaa Kar Mai Madh Moondat Soo An An Rachoo Hai||
translation: It seems that the creator, taking ambrosia in His hand, hath created an entity, saturated with nectar in every limb.

gurmukhi: Awnn kI sr ko ss nwihn Aaur kCU aupmw n bcI hY ]
transliteration: Aanan Koo Sar Ko Sas Naahin Aur Kachhodh Oupmaa Na Bachoo Hai||
translation: The moon doth not present an appropriate comparison for the face of goddess, nothing else also cannot be compared.

gurmukhi: siRMg sumyr ky cMf ibrwjq mwno isMGwsn bYTI scI hY ]79]
transliteration: Sring Soumer Ke Channd Biraajat Maano Singhaasan Baithoo Sachoo Hai||79||
translation: The goddess sitting on the summit of Sumeru appears like the queen of Indra (Sachi) seated on her throne.79.
